issue.title: when formState dirty is true but dirtyfields and touched size is 0?

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
Please consider asking the question at our spectrum channel.

https://spectrum.chat/react-hook-form


i use formState dirty value for check form data changed.
but i check my formState value in google console after useFieldArray add . 
dirty value true but dirtyfields size 0 and after remove  my field array dirty value true yet.
so i want to know when formState dirty is true but dirtyfields and touched size is 0. 
thank you make this lib~ 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59639025/76306386-1fa5be00-630a-11ea-838f-5ef0dc7d32f9.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
click append value twice and delete twice dirty value is true yet.

**Codesandbox link**
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-l6xcd?

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

body: @youngje4284 keep an eye on this one, i may need your help in terms of verify the fix.

i found out the reason with your issue @youngje4284. it's due to default value:

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-jxm8f

default value have `number` instead of `string`. input return string and default `value` is `number`, so it's the reason why it's not working as expected.

wow. you're genius... thank you very much.

Is there any intention to fix this ? Or if i should not use number type and only use string type ?
@youngje4284 i still have a PR for this issue which i have raised. i think you should keep them as string, so it match with what input returns (string)

I understand after your pr merged, i can use number type value  in field array.
but now i should to change number type to string. is this right?

> I understand after your pr merged, i can use number type value in field array.

no, this PR will fix dirtyFields not getting removed

> but now i should to change number type to string. is this right 

you should convert default value from number to string, we are not going to do the convert inside the lib.

input will consistently return string in this lib, just like native inputs.
ok i got it thank you~

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59639025/76387991-65669300-63ab-11ea-98b7-5d810258afcb.png)

I make check isFormDataChange this. because i use typescript and server get and post data type is number. so i think all number type to string convert for only this issue it is difficult. now is data change cheked works. thank you for help~

Hi @bluebill1049 ! I know this issue has been closed, but I was wondering if / when this bug fix will get released.

The `dirtyFields` are still not being updated when expected in the `formState` sandbox even though the sample is using the `latest`. Thanks!
https://codesandbox.io/s/7o2wrp86k6
hey @kcunanan dirtyFields is a `Set`, can you take a look at the dev console. let me know if that's fixed.

Ah got it. Looks like the `console.log(JSON.stringify(formState.dirtyFields));` misled me ðŸ˜… 

Thanks so much!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10050800/77375651-5e387100-6d2b-11ea-9507-de704b948555.png)
